Description: Rim sherd of East Greek, probably Chian, black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed; exterior, streaky black rim with traces of added colour; below, black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx facing left (upper body remaining; added white on flesh and wing; added red on hair, eye, and wing).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For other Chian black-figure atticising kantharoi, see Oxford AN1912.37h and AN1896-1908-G.1009.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 126, pl. XXXVIII, no. 353.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1899) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 232, no. 179)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5967 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
